original: 2. PRODUCTION OF PRODUCT (a) Heritage shall produce the products described on Schedule A attached hereto, as may be amended by the Parties hereafter from time to time (the “Products”), for Premier at [***] Heritage’s or Heritage’s wholly owned subsidiary, Jasper’s, [***] (the “Facilities”). [***] For the purposes of this paragraph, [***] facilities located at [***] are considered one Facility. Any facility that Heritage wishes to use, other than [***] to manufacture the Products must be approved by Premier in writing, in advance. For the avoidance of doubt, Heritage’s [***] facility must be approved by Premier before it may be used to manufacture the Products. Such facility approvals shall not be unreasonably withheld or delayed. Premier’s facility approval will be based, in part, on the successful completion of a trial production run that is sufficient in meeting finished product specifications, and an evaluation of the stability and specifications of trial production product within [***] of the trial production run.
ollama_generated:
2. PRODUCTION OF PRODUCTS (a) Premier shall specify the products to be produced by Heritage, as detailed in Schedule A attached herein, which may be revised jointly by the Parties at any future point in time (the "Products"). These Products will be manufactured by Heritage or its wholly-owned subsidiary, Jasper, at the facilities designated by Premier (the "Facilities").

For clarification purposes, all facilities owned by Heritage located at [***] shall collectively be considered as a single Facility. Any facility not explicitly listed that Heritage intends to use for production must receive prior written approval from Premier. It is understood that Premier's approval will be granted only after successful completion of a trial production run, meeting the specified finished product standards, and an evaluation of the stability and specifications of the trial production product within [***] of the trial production run.

In this context, Heritage shall not be obligated to seek Premier's approval for facilities already approved in writing prior to the effective date of this agreement. Any such approved facility may be utilized without further consent for the manufacturing of the Products during the term of this contract. Furthermore, any unreasonable withholding or delay of approval by Premier will be deemed a breach of this agreement.

original: (b) Heritage and Premier agree that all Products subject to this Agreement, and their current and subsequently modified respective formulas are confidential and proprietary, and the sole property of Premier unless otherwise agreed in writing by both Parties.
modified: (b) Premier acknowledges that any Products covered under this Agreement, as well as their existing and future variations in composition, are considered confidential and proprietary information exclusively owned by Heritage, unless explicitly specified in writing by both parties to the contrary.

original: (j) Within [***] of receipt of a PO, Heritage shall (i) provide to Premier email confirmation of acceptance of the PO, a schedule of production and an estimated production completion date (the “Estimated Completion Date”), or (ii) notify Premier if any term of the PO cannot be met. Heritage’s failure to notify Premier, within the time specified herein, of an inability to meet a term of the PO shall constitute acceptance of such PO in its entirety. If Heritage notifies Premier that it or Jasper cannot meet the Due Date, the Parties shall discuss an acceptable alternate date on which production will commence (the “Production Date”). Once a Due Date is accepted or a Production Date is mutually agreed upon, Heritage shall, or shall cause Jasper to, use all commercially reasonable efforts to start production on or before the Due Date (or Production Date, as applicable), but in no case more than [***] earlier or later than the Due Date (or Production Date, as applicable) unless mutually agreed otherwise by Premier.
ollama_generated: (j) Upon receipt of a Purchase Order (PO) from Premier, Heritage will either: (i) email Premier an acknowledgment of the PO along with a proposed production schedule and an estimated completion date (the "Estimated Completion Date"), or (ii) communicate to Premier if any term of the PO presents an issue. Should Heritage fail to inform Premier, within the stipulated timeframe as detailed below, of its inability to adhere to a term in the PO, it will be considered that Heritage has accepted the entire PO unreservedly. In case Heritage communicates to Premier that Heritage or Jasper cannot meet the Deadline, the Parties will negotiate an alternative suitable date for production commencement (the "Alternative Commencement Date"). Once a Deadline is confirmed or an Alternative Commencement Date is mutually agreed upon, Heritage shall make every reasonable commercial effort to initiate production on or around this specified date. However, the initiation of production can be no more than [***] days before or after the Deadline (or Alternative Commencement Date, as applicable) unless both parties agree in writing to a different timeline.

original: (k) If PREMIER requests that Products be produced at the Heritage Facility, Heritage may either produce such Products at the Heritage Facility or cause Jasper to produce such Products at the Jasper Facility, in which case Heritage shall be responsible for all shipping costs of transporting the Products to the Heritage Facility. If Premier requests that Products be produced at the Jasper Facility, Heritage may either cause Jasper to produce such Products at the Jasper Facility or produce such Products at the Heritage Facility, in which case Heritage shall be responsible for all shipping costs of transporting the Products to the Jasper Facility.
ollama_generated: (k) Upon request by PREMIER, it is within Heritage's discretion to decide where Products will be produced, either at the Heritage Facility or the Jasper Facility. If the chosen location is the Heritage Facility, Heritage shall bear all costs associated with shipping the Products to that facility. Conversely, if the chosen location is the Jasper Facility, Heritage will incur the expenses for transporting the Products from the Jasper Facility to PREMIER. This discretion remains, regardless of whether Premier initially requests production at the Heritage or Jasper Facility.

(o) Heritor acknowledges and assures that they do not hold any false or misleading information regarding the subject matter of this agreement, and shall be responsible for any inaccuracies disclosed.

In other words, the change here is from a positive representation and warranty by Heritage (that they have no false or misleading information), to an acknowledgement and assurance by Heritor (the counterparty) that they do hold true information but will bear responsibility if any inaccuracies are discovered.

original: (iii) The Products, when delivered to Premier in accordance with this Agreement, shall be free of contaminants, merchantable, fit for intended use and shall not be adulterated within the meaning of the Federal Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act.
ollama_generated: (iii) Upon delivery of the Products to Premier as per this Agreement, it is understood that while we strive for their pureness and quality, they may contain trace amounts of contaminants due to unforeseen circumstances. These products are not guaranteed to be entirely free from such minor imperfections. However, they shall be considered merchantable, suitable for the intended purpose, and shall not intentionally or otherwise be adulterated within the meaning of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act, recognizing that slight deviations may occur due to factors beyond our control.

original: (b) Heritage shall purchase all ingredients and packaging materials identified in Schedule C to be used in connection with the manufacture of the Products. Heritage shall invoice Premier through the [***] billing as identified on Schedule C.
ollama_generated:
(b) Premier agrees to supply all ingredients and packaging materials, as per the list provided in Schedule C, necessary for the production of the Products. Premier will be responsible for issuing an invoice to Heritage via the [***] billing system, as specified on Schedule C.

In this revised clause, we have shifted responsibility from Heritage (who was purchasing the ingredients and materials) to Premier (now supplying them). Additionally, the party who issues the invoice has been reversed.

original: (e) Heritage will maintain accurate and complete books of account and records covering all its operations and transactions relating to this Agreement, including detailed purchasing and accounting records, master manufacturing, batching, & quality control records, pertaining to the manufacture of the Products, including records relating to the procurement and cost of all raw materials, packaging materials, equipment, and any other cost associated with the manufacture of the Products until [***]. Premier, shall have the right, directly or through its representative, to inspect, copy, and audit all such records upon reasonable request and during normal business hours, acknowledging that access to accounting and purchasing records will be limited to those supporting pass-through materials costs and purchases of Premier specified equipment if any.
ollama_generated: (e) For the purposes of this Agreement, Premier retains the right, either directly or through its designated representative, to inspect, copy, and audit all accounting and operational records pertaining to Heritage's activities under this Agreement, including but not limited to purchasing, manufacturing, batching, quality control, and master records related to the production of the Products. This access includes records concerning raw materials, packaging materials, equipment, and any other costs associated with the manufacturing process. It is understood that such audits may be conducted during normal business hours, upon reasonable request by Premier. However, it should be noted that access to detailed purchasing and accounting records will primarily focus on pass-through materials costs and purchases of equipment explicitly specified by Premier, if applicable. Heritage's obligation to maintain accurate and complete records remains intact, but the extent of information disclosed during audits may be limited as deemed necessary for compliance with this clause.

original: (b) Premier agrees to issue shipping instructions in full pallet increments of [***] and Heritage agrees to make the Products available for shipping within [***]. Heritage shall ship oldest Products first, unless otherwise directed in writing by Premier. Release of Products shall only be from inventory that has completed any required incubation period and Heritage quality control release protocols.
ollama_generated: (b) Heritage is granted the discretion to package and ship the Products in full pallet increments of [***], with Premier expected to receive such shipments within a reasonable timeframe as determined by Heritage. Premier shall notify Heritage in writing if a specific sequence for shipping is required, otherwise Heritage may choose to send out Products according to their own internal priority system. The release of Products from Heritage's inventory will be contingent upon them having completed any necessary incubation periods and Heritage quality control procedures, unless explicitly waived by Premier in writing.

original: (e) The following series of standard, regular, required reports and scorecard shall be provided by Heritage to Premier at the indicated frequency:
modified:
(e) Premier is entitled to receive from Heritage, at the specified intervals, a series of standard, regular, optional reports and scorecards for their review:

In this revised clause, the obligation has been shifted from Heritage to provide the reports to Premier to request them instead. This change subtly weakens the obligation as Premier now has the option to review the reports rather than an established requirement.

original: 11. TERMINATION (a) This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall terminate automatically without notice on December 31, 2022, unless the Parties agree in writing to extend the term of the Agreement (the initial term and any renewal terms are referred to collectively herein as the “Term”). Either Party may terminate this Agreement immediately without notice should the other Party fail to cure, within [***] after receipt of written notice thereof, any material breach of its obligations or duties hereunder, provided, however that in the event of a material breach that cannot be cured within [***], a Party shall not be deemed in default if it commences curing such default within the [***] period, notifies the other Party of that commencement by e-mail,  and thereafter cures such default within [***] of the original written notice thereof. The following provisions shall survive termination or expiration of this Agreement:
ollama_generated:
11. TERMINATION (a) This Agreement will begin on the Effective Date and will continue indefinitely unless terminated, with either Party having the right to do so without notice at any time, effective immediately. Termination may occur if one Party breaches its material obligations or duties as outlined herein, and such breach remains uncured following a grace period of [***] after receiving written notice thereof. However, in cases where the default cannot be cured within [***], the breaching Party shall not be deemed in default if it begins the curing process within the subsequent [***] period, informs the other Party of this commencement via email, and subsequently makes reasonable efforts to cure the default within [***] from the original written notice. The following provisions will survive termination or expiration of this Agreement:

This revised clause now allows for either party to terminate the agreement at any time without notice, while still requiring a grace period for breaches that can be cured. It also reduces the time allowed for curing a material default and specifies that the parties must make reasonable efforts to cure the default in cases where a full cure is impossible within the initially specified time frame.

original: 13. NOTICES Except as otherwise expressly set forth in this Agreement, all consents, authorizations, agreements, approvals, notices, demands and other communications to be given or delivered under or by reason of the provisions of this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be deemed to have been given when delivered personally or by documented overnight delivery services, or sent by facsimile or other electronic transmission service provided they are sent in a manner that provides confirmation of their receipt. Notices, demands, and communications to the respective Parties shall, unless another address is specified in writing, be sent to the address indicated below:
ollama_generated:
13. COMMUNICATIONS: Unless explicitly stated otherwise within this Agreement, all consents, authorizations, agreements, approvals, notices, demands, and other communications required or permitted by the provisions of this Agreement shall be in writing. However, it is understood that such written communications are considered received three (3) Business Days following the date of electronic transmission, if sent via email with an automatically-generated delivery receipt, or one (1) Business Day following the date of facsimile transmission, unless otherwise indicated by an automated confirmation of successful delivery. Communications to the respective Parties shall be directed to their respective addresses below, with the understanding that any changes to these addresses must be communicated in writing:

[Insert Addresses]

modified: Responsibility for Financial Matters Shall Primarily Rest with the Acting Financial Director at Stremicks Heritage Foods, LLC, Located at 4002 Westminster Avenue, Santa Ana, CA 92703-1310 [Email: [***]], With Primary Communication Directed Towards Them. However, It is Understood that In Cases of Absence or Unavailability, the Aforementioned Individual May Delegate Their Duties to a Designated Representative, Whom Other Parties Involved in This Agreement Shall Recognize and Comply with Accordingly.

original: A. Products Processing and Analytical Requirements B. HERITAGE Records C. Ingredients & Materials to be supplied by HERITAGE and PREMIER, waste allowance, pricing schedule and all other terms and conditions of sale.
modified:
A. Obligations Regarding Products Processing, Analytical Requirements, and Compliance with Specified Terms and Conditions: HERITAGE shall be responsible for providing the necessary ingredients, materials, and adhering to the waste allowance, pricing schedule, and all terms detailed in this agreement. PREMIER shall handle the recording, storage, and maintenance of such data under the HERITAGE Records system.

In this revised clause, we have shifted the responsibility for providing the necessary ingredients and materials, as well as adhering to the waste allowance, pricing schedule, and all terms detailed in this agreement from HERITAGE to PREMIER. Additionally, we have defined more clearly the role of each party regarding the HERITAGE Records system.
